abstract.text: Begins a dragging session.

inlineContent.text: Use -[NSWindow beginDraggingSessionWithItems:event:source:] instead.

inlineContent.text: The object to be dragged.
Location of the image’s bottom-left corner in the window’s coordinate system. It determines the placement of the dragged image under the pointer.
The pointer’s location relative to the mouse-down location. Not used in macOS 10.4 and later.
The left-mouse down event that triggered the dragging operation.
The pasteboard that holds the data to be transferred to the destination.
The object serving as the controller of the dragging operation. It must conform to the
protocol.
Specifies whether the drag image should slide back to
if it’s rejected by the drag destination. Pass
to specify slide back behavior or
to specify that it should not.
This method should be invoked only from within a view’s implementation of the
or
methods (which overrides the version defined in
class). Essentially the same as the
method of the same name, except that
is given in the
object’s base coordinate system.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A set of methods that are implemented by the source object in a dragging session.
An object that contains information about an input action, such as a mouse click or a key press.
A high-level interface for manipulating image data.
An object that transfers data to and from the pasteboard server.
Informs the receiver that the user has pressed the left mouse button.
Informs the receiver that the user has moved the mouse with the left button pressed.
Initiates a dragging operation from the view, allowing the user to drag arbitrary data with a specified icon into any application that has window or view objects that accept dragged data.
A window that an app displays on the screen.
Begins a dragging session.
Registers a set of pasteboard types that the window accepts as the destination of an image-dragging session.
Unregisters the window as a possible destination for dragging operations.
A false value.
A true value.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
A point in a Cartesian coordinate system.
A two-dimensional size.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.

inlineContent.text: The object to be dragged.
Location of the image’s bottom-left corner in the window’s coordinate system. It determines the placement of the dragged image under the pointer.
The pointer’s location relative to the mouse-down location. Not used in macOS 10.4 and later.
The left-mouse down event that triggered the dragging operation.
The pasteboard that holds the data to be transferred to the destination.
The object serving as the controller of the dragging operation. It must conform to the
protocol.
Specifies whether the drag image should slide back to
if it’s rejected by the drag destination. Pass
to specify slide back behavior or
to specify that it should not.
Use -[NSWindow beginDraggingSessionWithItems:event:source:] instead.
